summary: This document is a residence agreement and payment record from The Salvation Army's Parkside Evangeline Residence in New York, dated November 8, 2002. It includes a letter of reference for a tenant, the standard terms of occupancy, and a payment receipt. A business card for Jeffrey E. Epstein is also included in the file.

events.title: Letter of Reference Issued
events.description: The Salvation Army issues a letter 'To Whom It May Concern' regarding a tenant who has been in good standing since March 27, 2001.

events.title: Rent Payment Made
events.description: A rent payment of $223.00 is recorded, likely for the tenant referenced in the letter.

locations: The Salvation Army Parkside Evangeline Residence, Gramercy Park South, New York, NY
The Villard House, 457 Madison Avenue, N.Y., NY 10022 (Jeffrey Epstein's business address)
keyFacts: The Salvation Army provided a letter of reference dated November 8, 2002, for a tenant in good standing since March 2001.
The document file includes a standard residence agreement outlining terms for room, board, and fees at the Parkside Evangeline Residence.
A payment record shows a rent payment of $223.00 was made on March 11, 2003.
A business card for Jeffrey E. Epstein of J. Epstein & Co., Inc., located at The Villard House in New York, is included in the document set.
The resident's name in the agreement and payment records is redacted or left blank, indicating the document pertains to an unidentified individual.
